summary: Lawrence "Larry" Page  is an American computer scientist.
full_text:
Lawrence "Larry" Page  is an American computer scientist and internet entrepreneur who co-founded Google Inc. with Sergey Brin, and is the CEO of Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc. After stepping aside as CEO in August 2001 in favour of Eric Schmidt, Page re-assumed the role in April 2011. He announced his intention to step aside a second time in July 2015 to become CEO of Alphabet, under which Google's assets would be re-organised. Under Page, Alphabet is seeking to deliver major advancements in a variety of industries. Page is the inventor of PageRank, Google's best-known search ranking algorithm.
Page is a board member of the X Prize Foundation  and was elected to the National Academy of Engineering in 2004. Page received the Marconi Prize in 2004.
